text: I will test it out today and let you know, thank you for your help!

Awesome stuff, this line worked:
`background-image: url("{{ get_asset_url('../images/logo.svg') }}");`

Hi I just had the following problem:

I'm using a plugin for a particular feature in my project.

The main js file for the plugin at a couple of points has '{# and #}' in. Which is the hubl comment tag.

So a large chunk of the plugin Im using was missing after HubSpot does it's compression.

Is there a way to stop this from happening?

for the mean time I've had to upload the JS to the file manager however I would much rather have it with the rest of my JS files.

See the screenshots attached
You should be able to wrap the file in `{% raw %} {% endraw %}` delimiters - more <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl#escaping-hubl-delimiters|here>.
Hey Guys need little help to fetch value from the blog post template and render it in the listing page template.
Hello, Is there a way to serve a resized and cropped image with 'resize_image_url' ? Or with something else? THanks
That is what that function does
Unfortunately, it only scales, not cropping
